orl_sentence: Once upon a time , two brothers , who lived on neighboring farms , fell into conflict . It was the first serious [MASK] in their 40 years' brotherhood .

Then one day the long tie fell apart . It resulted from a small misunderstanding , and then grew into a major difference , and eventually exploded into an exchange of [MASK] words followed by weeks of silence .
Very early one morning there was a(n) [MASK] on the elder brother's door .
He opened it to find a man with a carpenter's toolbox . I'm [MASK] for a few days' work , he said .
Perhaps you would have a few small jobs here and there . Could I help you ? Well as it happens there is , said the elder brother , [MASK] across the creek to his brother's farm .
My younger brother lives there . A conflict broke out between us and he used his bulldozer to dig the creek to [MASK] me and thus a gap exists between us .
My younger brother lives there . A conflict broke out between us and he used his bulldozer to dig the creek to annoy me and thus a gap [MASK] between us .
And I'll do something to [MASK] him back .
See that pile of wood over there ? I want you to build me a 3-metre-high fence , so I won't need to see him or his place anymore . The carpenter said , I think I understand the [MASK] .
Show me the nails and the digger and I'll be able to do a job that [MASK] you .
The elder brother had to go to town for supplies , so he helped the carpenter get the materials ready and then he was [MASK] for the day .
About sunset [MASK] the elder brother returned , the carpenter had just finished his job .
Much to the elder brother's shock : there was no [MASK] there at all ; instead there was a bridge , stretching from one side of the creek to the other .
Much to the elder brother's shock : there was no fence there at all ; instead there was a bridge , [MASK] from one side of the creek to the other .

And his younger brother was coming across the bridge . You are quite a fellow to build this bridge regardless of all I've said and done , he said . The two brothers then met in the middle of the bridge , taking each other's hand and [MASK] .
They then turned to see the carpenter [MASK] his toolbox on his shoulder .
No , wait , please [MASK] a few days .
I've a lot of other projects for you , said the older brother . I'd love to stay on , the carpenter said , but I have many more [MASK] to build .
My tenth Christmas was one I was not looking forward to . Money was tight . Mom said we were old enough not to count on [MASK] .
Just being together would be enough . We weren't the only family in our small community who would have a [MASK] Christmas .
But the knowledge that others were going through the same thing didn't [MASK] much .
One night we had a small pity party for each other . How can I even wear that same old dress one more time ? I [MASK] .
I know , said my sister . I think I might as well give up asking for a [MASK] .
The next day , Mom told us that she had been saving up and shopping around so that we could give the Walters family a Christmas basket . If anyone needs some [MASK] , it's the Walters .
Mom reminded us . The Walters ! They were the strangest people we knew . How could Mom be so [MASK] with them when our own family didn't have enough ?
Mom was determined . She packed flour and sugar , a small turkey , some fruits in a basket and asked us to [MASK] it to the Walters .
I really didn't like to have anything to do with them . Not wanting to be [MASK] , we left the basket on the doorstep and hid behind a nearby bush .

Seeing the Walters gather up their basket , I asked in whisper , Did they look happy ? Well , yeah , happy , but mostly they looked like they were thinking , Maybe we do belong . Christmas morning arrived . To my great [MASK] , I received a fabulous-looking dress .
I couldn't believe it's for me . I was about to speak [MASK] we noticed Dad ride up atop a new horse .
My sister screamed and ran out . She couldn't [MASK] to meet her gift .
Mom , how did you do all this ? I asked . We were [MASK] for a no-present Christmas .
Oh , not necessarily [MASK] but just helping each other .
Mrs . Olsen at the dress shop let me bring your gift home . Dad offered to hang up Mrs . Marshall's tree lights . Mr . Jones had a horse and he was [MASK] to know we had someone to love it .
I thought since you were giving away food to the Walters , we would never have enough . They really don't have anything to give in [MASK] .
We are like a big family . Never [MASK] who can or who can't give .
The most important is that we should listen to our hearts . Perhaps the right gifts will end up with the right families . Mom always knew [MASK] .
Thinking about the expression on the Walters's faces when they discovered the Christmas basket , I realized their [MASK] feeling was more precious than any of the gifts .
That was the Christmas that I learned about the magic of [MASK] .
Life is not always smooth . There was a man who had [MASK] numerous failures in his life .
But he said , One success is [MASK] for me !
When he was five years old , his father died of illness without leaving him any [MASK] .
Since then , his mother worked outside [MASK] he had to stay at home and take care of his siblings .
He learnt cooking since then . When he was fourteen , he dropped [MASK] and began his life of loving .
When he was eighteen , he married a girl , who , [MASK] , sold out all his properties and went back to her home several months after their marriage .
When he was twenty , he [MASK] his job from electrician to ferry staff to railway worker .
All his jobs were [MASK] for him .
When he was thirty-five , misfortune again [MASK] on him .

When he was driving across a huge bridge , the steel ropes along the edge of the bridge were broken and he fell into the river with his car . He suffered such severe injuries that he could no longer continue his [MASK] .
When he was [MASK] , he opened a gas station in a town .

However , he came into dispute because he beat his competitors owing to the billboard hanging problems . When he was forty-seven , he [MASK] his second wife , which had deeply stricken his three children .

However , he came into dispute because he beat his competitors owing to the billboard hanging problems . When he was forty-seven , he divorced his second wife , which had [MASK] stricken his three children .
When he was sixty-six , he made a living by [MASK] his chicken-frying techniques to various restaurants in different places .
When he was seventy-five , he felt [MASK] to maintain his company , so he transferred his brand and patent to others .

The new owner suggested giving him ten thousand stock shares as part of the purchasing price . But he turned down the suggestion . Later the price of the stocks of the company soared and he lost the chance of being a billionaire . When he was eighty-eight , he achieved great success and became well-known to the whole world . He was exactly the founder of Kentucky Fried Chicken , Ha Lunda Sandoz . He often said , People always complain about the bad [MASK] .
Actually it is not bad at all . As long as you are [MASK] and confident all the time , you will have a good weather every day .
